inventory.title: Inventory

inventory.buttonHowToSetUp: How to set up UOM correctly

dialogSetupBaseUnit.title: How to Set Up Unit of Measurement (UOM) Correctly

goFnBSystemAndUnit.title: GoFnB System and Unit of Measurement (UOM)
goFnBSystemAndUnit.paragraph:
Go Fnb uses the international standard units, called UOM (Unit of Measurement) , that is listed below to measure and track inventory in weight, volume or countable quantity
• WEIGHT: kg (kilograms), g (grams), mg (milligrams), lbs (pounds), oz (ounces)
• VOLUME: L (liters), dL (deciliters), cL (centiliters), mL (milliliters), fl oz (US fluid ounces), fl oz (imperial fluid ounces), gal (US gallons), gal (imperial gallons), fl pt (US pints), fl pt (imperial pints), fl qt (US quarts), fl qt (imperial quarts)
• COUNTABLE QUANTITY: piece

howToSetupUOMForAnIngredient.title: How to set up UOM for an ingredient
howToSetupUOMForAnIngredient.paragraph: When you set up UOM for an ingredient, it is important to think about your recipe and define if you want Go FnB system to track and record your ingredient in mass, volume, or counted quantity . For example, if you select ‘kg (kilograms),’ that will give you options in g (grams) and mg (milligrams), lbs (pounds), oz (ounces) , when you use the ingredient to set up product recipe later. You do NOT need to set 1 kg = 1000 g because our system will handle it.

howToSetupYourOwnUnits.title: How to set up your own units
howToSetupYourOwnUnits.paragraph: You can also set up your own units to fit your business needs by clicking on “add conversion with new unit” . And these units need to be tied to the UOM. For example, if you buy a crate of 5 bags of lime, with 1 bag = 1.2 kg, for your supply, you can set unit conversions as the following photo.

limitationOfGoFnBSystem.title: Limitation of GoF&B system
limitationOfGoFnBSystem.paragraph: The system CANNOT convert a weight unit (e.g., kilogram) into a volume unit (e.g., liter) or countable-quantity unit (piece) , and vice versa, the system cannot convert a volume unit or countable-quantity unit to a weight unit, UNLESS you set the conversion for this yourself. For instance, regarding the example of the ingredient “Lime” above, that setup only gives you options in kg, g, mg, lbs, oz, Bag (1.2 kg), and Crate (5 Bag), which are 5 UOMs and 2 unit that you set up yourself. However, when you set up a recipe using Lime, you want to use mL for lime, and you know 1 mL of pure lime juice can be made from 1.5 g of lime, You can set this conversion as the following photo shown. That will give you the option in mL later. Please note, this mL unit is not defined as UOM in the system, but your own unit, so the system cannot convert that mL unit to L for you.

promotion.title: Discount Campaign Management

promotionSetting.title: Promotion setting
promotionSetting.noteApplyByProduct: *The promotion will be applied on each Product.
promotionSetting.noteApplyByOrder: *The promotion will be applied on Order.
promotionSetting.noteApplyMultiStageProduct: *Allows combining promotions on the same Product.
promotionSetting.noteApplyMultiStageBoth: *Allows combining promotions on the same Product and on an Order.
promotionSetting.noteApplyPromotionManually: *Allows cashier to create the promotion manually when creating an order.
promotionSetting.flashSaleTooltip: Flash sale product is a special product, It will not apply other promotions anymore
promotionSetting.discountAmountThenPercent: Discount the amount first, then discount by %
promotionSetting.exampleProduct:
Multistage is ON:

  • The promotions can be able to combine together on the same product (not including the Flash sales product )

Multistage is OFF:

  • The promotions cannot be combined together on the same product. They will only be chosen 1, depending on the priority and the most valuable discounted.

Example:

  1. Product Coffee has price = {{currency}}
    • There are 2 discount Codes applying to the product Coffee
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
      Code NEW
      -20%
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Coffee
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  2. Product Milk tea has price = {{currency}}
    • There is 1 discount Code applying to the product Milk tea
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Milk tea
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  3. Shop has another discount campaign Total bill = 20%

Buyer add (1) item Coffee + (2) items Milk tea to Cart:

=> SUBTOTAL (before discounted) = ({{currency}} x 1 + {{currency}} x 2) = {{currency}}

  • If we configured ON (mean ALLOW to combine promotions together) -> The Buyer will get all discounts on the product Coffee AND all discounts on product Milk tea:

    • Total discount amount on product Coffee = {{currency}} + (20% x {{currency}} ) + (50% x {{currency}} ) = {{currency}}

    Total discount amount on product Milk tea = [{{currency}} + (50% x {{currency}} )] x 2 = 1{{currency}}

    => Total discount amount for the ORDER = {{currency}} + 1{{currency}} = {{currency}}

  • If we configured OFF (mean DO NOT ALLOW to combine promotions together) -> The Buyer will get only 1 highest discounted promotion for product Coffee AND only 1 highest discounted promotion for product Milk tea:

    • Total discount amount on product Coffee = (50% x {{currency}}) = {{currency}}

    Total discount amount on product Milk tea = (50% x {{currency}}) x 2 = {{currency}}

    => Total discount amount for the ORDER = {{currency}} + {{currency}} = 1{{currency}}
promotionSetting.exampleOrder:
Multistage is ON:

  • Multiple promotions can be combined together in 1 order

Multistage is OFF:

  • Only 1 promotion can be applied to the entire order, the promotion that has the highest discount value will be applied.

Example:

  1. Product Coffee has price = {{currency}}
    • There are 2 discount Codes applying to the product Coffee
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
      Code NEW
      -20%
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Coffee
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  2. Product Milk tea has price = {{currency}}
    • There is 1 discount Code applying to the product Milk tea
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Milk tea
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  3. Shop has a discount campaign on Total bill Total bill = 20%
  4. Shop has a discount campaign on Total bill DISCOUNT20K = {{currency}}

Buyer add (1) item Coffee + (2) items Milk tea to Cart:

=> SUBTOTAL (before discounted) = ({{currency}} x 1 + {{currency}} x 2) = {{currency}}

  • If we configured ON (mean ALLOW to combine promotions together) -> The Buyer will get all discounts on the Total bill:

    • Discount on the Total bill = {{currency}} + ( {{currency}} x 20%) = {{currency}}

    => Total discount amount for the ORDER = 76.000{{currency}}

  • If we configured OFF (mean DO NOT ALLOW to combine promotions together) -> The Buyer will get only 1 promotion for Total bill, the highest discount value will be apply (in above sample: the promotion 20% will be applied)

    • => Total discount amount for the ORDER = 300.000 x 20% = {{currency}}
promotionSetting.exampleCombined:
Multistage is ON:

  • The promotions for Product: CAN be combined together on the same product (not including the Flash sales product )
  • The promomtions for the Total bill: CAN be combined to gether in 1 order

Multistage is OFF:

  • The promotions for Product: CANNOT be combined together on the same product. The promotion that has the highest discount value will be applied.
  • The promotions for Total bill: CANNOT be combined together on the entire order. The promotion that has the highest discount value will be applied.

Example:

  1. Product Coffee has price = {{currency}}
    • There are 2 discount Codes applying to the product Coffee
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
      Code NEW
      -20%
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Coffee
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  2. Product Milk tea has price = {{currency}}
    • There is 1 discount Code applying to the product Milk tea
      • Code FREESHIP
      {{currency}}
    • There is 1 normal discount campaign applying to the product Milk tea
      • Campaign Energy day
      -50%
  3. Shop has another discount campaign Total bill = 20%
  4. Shop has a discount campaign on Total bill DISCOUNT20K = {{currency}}

Buyer add (1) item Coffee + (2) items Milk tea to Cart:

=> SUBTOTAL (before discounted) = ({{currency}} x 1 + {{currency}} x 2) = {{currency}}

  • If we configured ON (mean ALLOW to combine promotions together)-> The Buyer will get all discounts on the product Coffee AND all discounts on the product Milk tea AND all discounts on the Total bill:

    • Total discount amount on product Coffee = {{currency}} + (20% x {{currency}} ) + (50% x {{currency}} ) = {{currency}}

    Total discount amount on product Milk tea = [{{currency}} + (50% x {{currency}} )] x 2 = 1{{currency}}

    Discount on the Total bill = {{currency}} + ( {{currency}} - {{currency}} - 1{{currency}}) x 20% = {{currency}}

    => Total discount amount for the ORDER = {{currency}} + 1{{currency}} + {{currency}} = {{currency}}

  • If we configured OFF (mean DO NOT ALLOW to combine promotions together) -> The Buyer will get only 1 highest discounted promotion for the product Coffee AND only 1 highest discounted promotion for the product Milk tea AND only 1 highest discounted promotion for the Total bill:

    • Total discount amount on product Coffee = (50% x {{currency}}) = {{currency}}

    Total discount amount on product Milk tea = (50% x {{currency}}) x 2 = {{currency}}

    Discount on the Total bill = ({{currency}} - {{currency}} - {{currency}}) x 20% = {{currency}}

    => Total discount amount for the ORDER = {{currency}} + {{currency}} + {{currency}} = 1{{currency}}

condition.title: Coupon conditions
condition.pleaseSelectSpecificBranches: Please select branch to apply the promotion
condition.specificBranchesTooltip: Uncheck means the promotion will be applied to all branches

guideline.title: Promotion applying rules
guideline.content:
• The priority applied Promotion will be:
    1. Discount on total bill
    2. Discount on specific category
    3. Discount on specific product
  • If there are multiple Promotions has same type -> Apply the Promotion which has highest discount
  • If the discount value is over the item price:
    • If promotion has set maximum value -> Discount the maximum value which setup
    • If order price after discount less than 0 -> Order price will be set to 0

configureDomain.title: Configure Domain
configureDomain.subTitle:
* In this scope of the guideline, we use GoDaddy as the Domain provider
(Do the same with order Domain providers: Domain.com, Namecheap, bluehost, IONOS,...)
configureDomain.step1Label: Please input your website domain here
configureDomain.step2: STEP 2: Navigate to DNS Management in GoDaddy
configureDomain.step2Label: Add these 2 nameservers to the DNS management in GoDaddy portal
configureDomain.step3: STEP 3: Check Name server mapping status
configureDomain.step3Label: To use your Domain, make sure your authoritative DNS or nameservers have been changed. These are your assigned GoF&B nameservers.
configureDomain.nameServerHasBeenUpdatedMessage: The nameserver has been updated successfully
configureDomain.waitingToDomainServer: Processing: waiting to domain server update name server...
configureDomain.waitTo24hoursToProcessNameServerChanges: Registrars take up to 24 hours to process nameserver changes (quicker in most cases). We will email you when {{customDomain}} is active on Cloudflare.
configureDomain.cloudflareWillRespondToDNSQueries: While in this pending state, Cloudflare will respond to DNS queries on your assigned nameservers.
configureDomain.automaticOptimizationsWillActivatedWithP: Once activated, SSL/TLS, DDoS protection, caching, and other automatic optimizations will go live for proxied DNS records, along with any custom settings you pre-configure.
configureDomain.onlyCheckOncePerHour: The verification for the nameservers of {{customDomain}} is being checked. You may only submit a re-check once per hour.
configureDomain.step4Label: Ensure your domain name is not blank and The mapping status is active
configureDomain.updateCustomDomainSuccessMessage: The website is updated to the new domain {{customDomain}}
configureDomain.checkMappingStatusWarningMessage: The nameservers have not been updated, please wait and check again

warningModal.title: Submit failed
warningModal.description:
The status of nameserver mapping is inactive. It mean the nameserver have not been added to the DNS management of the provider portal.

Please ensure you have added these 2 nameservers to the DNS management in the domain provider portal.

build.title: Application Building
build.requestBuildSuccess: Application build request has been sent successfully
build.validateUploadFile: Please upload your file before build
build.validateConfigKey: Please config your key before build
build.guideline1: To publish the mobile application of the Store, you need to set up some required configurations before enjoying it.
build.guideline2: Following are some configurations from 3rd parties that need to be set up before publishing the Application:

appName.title: App name
appName.description: The App name will be displayed in the Google Play store and Apple Store so that users can search and download your app
appName.placeholder: Please enter the name of your application

bundleId.title: Bundle ID
bundleId.description: The bundle ID or bundle identifier uniquely identifies an application in Apple’s. This means that no two applications can have the same bundle identifier.
bundleId.help: *You only need to set it once

packageId.title: Package ID
packageId.description: The package ID or package identifier uniquely identifies an application in Android’s ecosystem. This means that no two applications can have the same package identifier.

appLogo.title: App’s logo
appLogo.description1: The mobile application needs a logo icon to display on the device.
appLogo.description3: If the logo is not set, the app will use the default logo (GoF&B Logo).

googleFirebaseService.title: Google Firebase service
googleFirebaseService.description: Google Firebase service is used to send OTP to the user's device. It will help users log in to the app using their phone number without needing a username/password.
googleFirebaseService.validateFileType: Please upload file .json or .plist for Google Firebase service field

firebaseCredential.title: Firebase credential JSON
firebaseCredential.description1: The Firebase Credential JSON is used to send notifications to the devices that install the app. It will help to approach customers more easily in marketing campaigns.
firebaseCredential.description2: If the Firebase Credential JSON is not configured, the notification features cannot be used.
firebaseCredential.validateFileType: Please upload file .json for Firebase credential field

googleMapsApiKey.title: Google Maps API key
googleMapsApiKey.description1: The Google map KEY is used to locate the Buyer's location. It will help to calculate the distance and then provide the corresponding shipping fee.
googleMapsApiKey.description2: The Google map KEY is required. The order cannot be created if it has not been configured.

cashierScreen.title: Cashier screen
cashierScreen.annotate: Cashier screen is the screen where cashiers create and manage customers’ orders and their payment
cashierScreen.receiptsAfterOrderIsCreated: receipt(s) after an order is created
cashierScreen.receiptsAfterOrderIsPaid: receipt(s) after an order is paid
cashierScreen.receiptsAtOrder: receipt(s) at order management / order details
cashierScreen.orderSlipsAfterCreate: order slip(s) after an order is created
cashierScreen.autoConfirmOrderNote: The online orders will be automatically confirmed without any manual action by staff
cashierScreen.allowOrderOutOfStock: Allow to order products that are out of ingredients
cashierScreen.allowOrderOutOfStockNote: This allows customer to order food and drinks that have run out of ingredients
cashierScreen.staffWillContactForReserve: Staff will contact and arrange the table by themselves after receiving the reservation request
cashierScreen.lockReservationPeriodOfTime: Lock a reservation for a period of time
cashierScreen.reserveAtFixedTime: Reserve table at a fixed time
cashierScreen.requiredTimeReservation: Required time in advance to make a reservation
cashierScreen.timeToAutoConfirm: Time to auto confirm order after it is created
cashierScreen.allowReservation: Allow customers to reserve tables in advance
cashierScreen.autoPrintItemStickersAfterOrderCreated: Auto print item sticker(s) after an order is created
cashierScreen.allowPrintItemStickerAtOrderManagement: Allow to print item sticker(s) at order management / order details

customerScreen.title: Customer screen
customerScreen.annotate: Customer screen is the screen where customers check, confirm, and pay for their order
customerScreen.displayWhenNoOrder: The screen displays by default when there is no order
customerScreen.displayWhenOrdering: The screen displays on the left when customer is ordering

kitchenSystem.title: Kitchen system
kitchenSystem.annotate: Kitchen system is the POS screen where kitchen staff manage orders  that are created by cashiers or customers themselves
kitchenSystem.autoPrintStamp: Auto print stamp after order item is prepared successfully
kitchenSystem.averageTimeCooking: Average time to process an order

Before approved, this number is not static, it will be changed corresponding to the period of time

Please note that: The system quantity will be updated to this quantity after the request is approved

promotionCampaign.buyAllProducts: Customers just need to buy all products listed below

promotionCampaign.getAmount: Then customers will get m(% or VND/each) off of Y

promotionCampaign.getWillAllProduct: Customers will get all products listed below
promotionCampaign.limitCustomer: Limit to one use per customer
promotionCampaign.limitUsedInTotal: Limit number of orders this Buy X get Y can be used in total
promotionCampaign.limitUsedPerOrder: Limit number of times this Buy X get Y can be used per order
